longInfo:
Passport required.
- Nationals of Germany traveling without a passport must have
  a document accepted for entry, valid on arrival. 
- Nationals of Germany are allowed to enter with expired (max.
  1 year) passports and National ID cards  Personalausweis .
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of a National ID Card: 
 - issued to nationals of Germany ( Personalausweis ); 
- Holders of a German: 
  Travel Permit Issued in lieu of Passport ("Reiseausweis als
  Passersatz"), provided accompanied by ID containing a photo;
  or 
  Travel Permit Issued in lieu of Passport for Entry into the
  Fed. Rep. of Germany ("Reiseausweis als Passersatz zur
  Einreise in die Bundesrepublik Deutschland"). 
- Holders of a German Child's travel document in lieu of
  passport (Kinderausweis). A photo is required for children
  over 10 years of age.  

VISA NOT REQUIRED.

Minors:
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Germany will be expected to
  hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
- All minors who are nationals of Germany are expected to hold
  their own travel document.
Additional Information:
- Extension of stay is possible for visa exempt visitors. They
  must report to the Police Headquarters in Malta, no later
  than one week prior to expiration of visa exemption
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission For details, click here.

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 9 months of age who are subject to isolation
  or surveillance when indicated. 
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
  transmission provided not leaving the transit areas.
